title: 110_hr938
content: The "Nuclear Family Priority Act" changes family-sponsored immigrant categories to prioritize spouses and children of permanent resident aliens for visa allocation within specified worldwide levels. SEC. 3 of the Nuclear Family Priority Act amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to change the worldwide level of family-sponsored immigrants. The amendment includes adjustments to the number of family-sponsored immigrants for each fiscal year. SEC. 4 includes conforming amendments. The Nuclear Family Priority Act amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to change the worldwide level of family-sponsored immigrants. In any fiscal year, 75 percent of visa numbers under section 203(a) will be issued without regard to numerical limitations, while the remaining 25 percent will be allocated for countries subject to subsection (e). In any fiscal year, 75 percent of visa numbers under section 203(a) will be issued without regard to numerical limitations, while the remaining 25 percent will be available for foreign states or dependent areas subject to subsection (e) if the total number of visas issued to natives of the state or area is less than the subsection (e) ceiling. The subsection (e) ceiling is defined as 77 percent of the maximum number of visas that may be made available under section 203(a) to immigrants who are natives of the state or area. In subsection (e), rules for determining whether certain aliens are children are amended. Section 204 of the Immigration and Nationality Act is also amended regarding the procedure for granting immigrant status. The Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1154) is amended in subsection (a)(1) to simplify classification by relationship under section 203(a) and to clarify petition adjudication for individuals under 21 years of age. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to simplify classification by relationship under section 203(a) and clarify petition adjudication for individuals under 21 years of age. Amendments include changes to waivers of inadmissibility, conditional permanent resident status for certain alien spouses and children, and classes of deportable aliens. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to simplify classification by relationship under section 203(a) by striking ``203(a)(2)'' and inserting ``203(a)''. The amendments made by this Act will take effect on the first day of the second fiscal year after enactment, invalidating certain petitions and visa applications related to family-sponsored immigrant categories eliminated by the Act.
